document.title: District of Columbia Health Education Standards

E959FB7D305B447F81252578D3E771B7.description: Use effective nonverbal and verbal communication skills to express needs, wants, and feelings (e.g., saying 'no').

D8874627C93749C5AD50164EB771381F.description: Compare and contrast characteristics of products that are safe and unsafe to consume.

464FA425CF17409EA82F34633BA04233.description: Identify rules for taking medicines at school or at home.

1648C6BDA2F04CD38C2520A8624AE1AD.description: Identify trusted adults who can provide accurate information and guidance regarding medicines and common household products.

DE00B5E951F948DEA85C84EF8A6A9FC8.description: Describe the consequences of misusing medicines and household products.

164CBB9AE4EE4BD0AEBD9A9948B0580B.description: Describe safe and responsible uses for medicines and household products.

434C998289684B50AB721DC26645F07A.description: Practice how to ask for healthy food choices.

40602565EED542FCABA5A7DDA9CC5A87.description: Recognize a nutritious meal or snack.

C9A2CBCD55D44886904A2230AE604E84.description: Understand the concept of variety in diet and explain why it is important to health (within and between food groups).

3733DA45BA3945F6B05E452F4B7BEF4F.description: Set a goal to choose healthy foods for snacks and meals.

C8B81A107D574D2EA8C108749807DC34.description: Distinguish the feeling of hunger from the feeling of being satiated or full.

B587B74FDC074F9BB070D922AB9D68DD.description: Describe criteria for making healthy vs. less healthy food choices.

2E1BBBFC1F3E45EAB5D1F04E7DDABD1C.description: Identify members of the school community who are reliable sources of information about healthy foods.

0E7610AC8B244C4E9234E167074B1482.description: Identify community members who grow or sell healthy food and the importance of consuming locally grown food.

BA1A38B1095A463A981886B0737EFB76.description: Recognize that not all products advertised or sold are good for growing bodies.

454D4E07C9174E0B993EE1015B55D2BB.description: Explain how culture, media, peers, family, and other factors influence eating behaviors.

469BACAAF4A44754BA185B0A3218EB60.description: Identify foods that should be limited (e.g. non-nutrient dense foods, or foods high in sugar, salt, or fat).

01D52D55913B4548B375157EF4AA6332.description: Explain the benefits of drinking water and making healthy beverage choices.

F8FD8EEA1E82405BAE7D0735BF5727D2.description: Categorize foods according to food sources and food groups (e.g., plant, animal, and processed).

210B4DE8DB3C4275A9F1CD896721A7A3.description: Explain why healthy bodies require rest, exercise, and good nutrition.

8495C70EAD8F4FB8995E01033AD68B5A.description: Practice habits that are good for the environment (e.g., picking up trash, conserving water, and recycling).

C7C723E023AF482B8B999EE71FAE3649.description: Demonstrate dental and personal hygiene practices (e.g., hand-washing; proper technique of brushing and flossing; and covering coughs).

C14C8BA89D2A41F9B70985AA4E046007.description: Identify individuals who provide health information and promote healthy behavior in schools and the community.

AACB504929794523B2E8F9B937E0A678.description: Identify ways that schools, family, and friends can influence positive health practices.

5AB5DC4D727B40E69CC98B98D31E606F.description: Describe the different types of pollution (e.g., air, water, waste) and the effect they have on health.

519CED470EBF4AFDBA12F49BEA68AF0E.description: Explain how clean school, home, and community environments prevent the spread of germs.

D997FD0367EA4D70B0361FDF07CCCF85.description: Identify behaviors that promote health and prevent illness (e.g., proper hygiene, proper nutrition, adequate sleep, vaccinations, and exercise).

E149314E80474D328DC222498D30E567.description: Identify the causes and common symptoms (e.g., runny nose, coughing, sneezing) of illness.

181F925CA0894D0D9B52CA3014A4E417.description: Describe how individual bodies are different and equally special.

C791400C98F748B89A3BBF9236DCCC86.description: Differentiate between healthy and unhealthy relationships.

11CB02853D1941E5A2E6A60FC3278567.description: Explain why sleep and rest are important for proper growth and good health.

E6F5345892C744D498F0F14526C5E25D.description: Identify different kinds of family structures.

2D37A293FBC149A7B5D43DEED4035F4E.description: Describe the basic functions of the five senses.

A63E4BC149CF4E938E92647A4C0F5242.description: Identify different body types/sizes and how people's bodies change as they grow older.

2C6B2D66964E4385BCCC017975605E38.description: Explain biological differences between men and women.

99CC41C2A4344D6F978799D264CEB995.description: Describe how the skeletal and muscular systems help humans move and protect parts of the body.

356D96BD9DD64F15AD9D88F3159DF596.description: Name and locate the basic body organs, including the heart, brain, lungs, skin, and stomach and describe their functions.

8CCC6DF258824FD48BB536F0D67B5DBF.description: Explain that all people, including children, have the right to tell others not to touch their body when they do not want to be touched.

BB8E6001DF664828A302E6998003BA7D.description: Explain what to do in an emergency at home or school (e.g. what to do if someone is choking or if there is a fire).

F29A0DDC5D3C4D2092A200602B7A3B12.description: Interpret the basic traffic, pedestrian, and public transportation signs and symbols.

A5999C93432847CC8AB7B2AFBF1D8F50.description: Demonstrate safe ways to respond to teasing, harassment, and bullying.

8454CFA2FED9496D89442DA212614C4A.description: Identify a trusted person to talk to about being bullied, teased, or abused in any way.

F10319E713A94D21B0CED266704FC636.description: Demonstrate how to ask for help and express needs in a productive manner.

9F63EBFD8F514E399D72D3D2C9980792.description: Take steps to achieve a personal goal to avoid or reduce injury.

2153DFDFBF044574984B1E791E15F290.description: Make appropriate decisions about safe behaviors around strangers (e.g., getting in cars or taking treats from strangers).

F7FB5766C55B48E7B9907298EDF8765D.description: Demonstrate ways to refuse and report inappropriate touch.

957D1A9CB4C040BAA9B2CFB9CFD7C204.description: Demonstrate healthy ways to respond to disagreements or conflicts with others.

A6C1F4D42D804A8494F4F2FAE729DDFD.description: Identify and demonstrate how to communicate to others the importance of respecting personal boundaries, space, and property.

02D3B479FC76444787409A0A18D09BCE.description: Identify common signs, symbols, and warning labels and what they mean (e.g., a poison symbol on a container).

8C8DC1A77FEA4A54B11C298C42531202.description: Identify community helpers and describe their role in keeping communities safe.

3EF793492D624B4E9C761DBF3EFB5473.description: Identify the influences of health and safety rules on home, school, and community environments.

CA04415FDF274C2EBFCADFB6AE32DA91.description: Identify items that could be considered a weapon and how to seek help if a weapon is found.

35E6577863654C4491F90862E709F4F6.description: Describe safety hazards, including those related to fire, water, dangerous objects and how to seek help in these situations.

B8E665613EE542A79F505D4BF0F8A628.description: Recognize the difference between good and bad touch.

29662CCC81AF4ECE83B52D693055CA1F.description: Explain the importance of respecting personal boundaries, space, and property.

E7AE35010C3F459EB31E3CFFAB067533.description: Recognize bullying, teasing, and aggressive behaviors as hurtful and potentially harmful.

6D89756F3CBE499EA15203FDB202E318.description: Identify how rules promote safety and that following rules can prevent injuries.

AB5FAC632DEA40AC8697D451114B8C3D.description: Explain ways children can model healthful behaviors for others.

3C0BF7206E6E4A8A9478F1863C336FF5.description: Encourage others to appreciate their differences.

DBA3F877DC7D4CDDBCE28D5540CCB312.description: Describe positive and negative ways of acting on emotions.

9DCF3F540F6B45B2AF95D0AA7532116A.description: Demonstrate how to express personal needs and wants appropriately.

09590474046F4E2A8AE6855881BF8226.description: Identify trusted persons and how to get help if something is bothering you.

062808D2D5614AF39B0A966CC71FD5BE.description: Identify positive and negative influences on mental and emotional health practices and behaviors.

32AB5BEC095C4B5BA171442012895559.description: Describe the difference between bullying and teasing.

2F609878E0C747A687ADE3E4AA18021F.description: Describe what respect is and why it is important.

0143CAD401EA476C9723908C55CD0B06.description: Explain the impact of different emotions on self and others.

2752CA01AFD747ADB8879701AC7D0486.description: Identify basic emotions and positive and negative ways of dealing with emotions in a variety of situations.
